pr_title: Fix handling of search shard failures in the coordinating node

timeline.message:
Fix handling of search shard failures in the coordinating node

This commit ensures that we catch exceptions that happens when the coordinating
node consumes a shard response. Such failures can happen if we need to compute
the serialized size of an aggregation that was computed locally and the serialization
fails. In such case, we now return a shard error rather than an uncaught NPE for the entire
search.

timeline.bodyText: Is it needed both conditions? I would expect that if reducePhase.aggregations is not null, then hasAggs is always true?
timeline.author: iverase

replies.bodyText: I added a comment in baabbbd, it can be null if all shards failed.
replies.author: jimczi

timeline.bodyText: I find this change hard to follow, I am sure I am missing something. Why do we need the conditional compared to before? And why do we call asSerialized when the aggregation is already serialized?
timeline.author: javanna

replies.bodyText: This is just to avoid serializing on a real buffer since we don't need to keep the result if the aggregations is already expanded. However I agree that it can be confusing so I pushed c867307 to address your concerns. Does it look better ?
replies.author: jimczi
